snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon said he was obligated to prevent potential violence as the St. Louis area braced for a grand jury decision on whether to indict a police officer in the fatal shooting of Michael Brown.
abstract: Missouri Gov Jay Nixon says that Missouri National Guard is part of multiforce contingency plan by law enforcement authorities to avert violence as region around St Louis awaits grand jury's return in death of Michael Brown.

byline.original: By ELI YOKLEY and MONICA DAVEY
byline.contributor: Eli Yokley reported from Weldon Spring, and Monica Davey from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon said he was obligated to prevent potential violence as the St. Louis area braced for a grand jury decision on whether to indict a police officer in the fatal shooting of Michael Brown.

headline.main: Missouri Governor Says National Guard Is Still Option in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Governor Says Guard Is Still Option in Ferguson
